description: Write n = m^k with m, k integers, k >= 1, then a(n) = smallest possible choice for m.
comments: Value of m in m^p=n, where p is the largest possible power (see A052409).For n>1, n is a perfect power iff a(n)<>n. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 13 2002a(n)^A052409(n) = n. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 06 2014
links: Daniel Forgues, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..100000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Perfect Power
prog: (Haskell)a052410 n = product $ zipWith (^)                      (a027748_row n) (map (`div` (foldl1 gcd es)) es)            where es = a124010_row n-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 15 2012
author: _Eric W. Weisstein_
extensions: Definition edited (in a complementary form to A052409) by Daniel Forgues, Mar 14 2009
Corrected by _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 02 2009
Definition edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 03 2010
